title: Ticket #959: Linking both old and new ClassAds on AIX
description:
Building V7_3-new_classads-branch on AIX is failing due to this error: ld: 0711-781 ERROR: TOC overflow. TOC size: 67584 Maximum size: 65536

It appears including both old and new ClassAds takes us over the normal limit on global symbols in the schedd. There is a -Wl,-bbigtoc flag to increase the size, but it comes with a performance hit.

We should try to link in only one of old and new ClassAds for executables that don't explicitly need both (e.g. the job router or better analyze).

Here are some links with more information:

  • http://www-949.ibm.com/software/rational/cafe/blogs/ccpp-commercial/2008/12/23/toc-overflow-what-is-it-and-why-should-you-care
  • http://www-949.ibm.com/software/rational/cafe/blogs/ccpp-commercial/2009/01/23/dealing-with-toc-overflow-the-traditional-approach
  • http://www-949.ibm.com/software/rational/cafe/blogs/ccpp-commercial/2009/04/19/toc-overflow-getting-help-from-the-xl-compilers
remarks:
2009-Nov-16 23:08:04 by matt:
Is this AIX laughing at us for having huge amounts of global symbols?

What programs failed to link? I'd venture a guess and say the Collector and Schedd.

2010-Jan-14 15:57:18 by jfrey:
Add these command-line options to gcc eliminate the problem: -mno-fp-in-toc -mno-sum-in-toc -mminimal-toc
